pullRequest.body:
This PR adds a positivity extension for integer powers, i.e. `a ^ (r : ‚Ñ§)`. It's basically copy-pasted from the natural power extension. Note that this makes the imports of `Mathlib.Tactic.Positivity.Basic` slightly heavier since the required lemmas were not there (and the relevant file doesn't import positivity so I couldn't put it there either). It's probably not too bad, but I can put it in a new file if people think this would be better.

---

nodes.body: What's the situation here? I would like this in mathlib üòÑ

I reverted this to the initial version of the PR, before [my first comment](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/8003#discussion_r1377999179), and I switched to [the more localized way of suppressing the linter that I suggested above](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/8003#discussion_r1398479470).
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.
bors merge

maintainer merge

LGTM!

maintainer merge
Is it possible to use `Even.zpow_nonneg` here, instead of `zpow_bit0_nonneg`? Would that remove the need for the `linter.deprecated false`?

Yes (see the current version), but this adds extra imports (namely `Mathlib.Data.Int.Parity`) to get `Int.even_iff`, and the way it's coded now the `unusedHavesSuffices` linter flags a line that doesn't seem spurious (at least I don't know how to remove it). Doesn't seem worth it unless we're actually planning to remove `bit0` entirely.

Hm... I think I agree that we should try to avoid adding that new dependency.

In your original code, you can dodge `linter.deprecated` by doing this:
```diff
-    haveI' : $b =Q bit0 $m := ‚ü®‚ü©
+    haveI' : $b =Q $m + $m := ‚ü®‚ü© -- b = bit0 m
```

That seems better to me than disabling the linter for the entire declaration.
I think you can also work around the linter by renaming the variable to `_b_mod_two` with a leading underscore.

Can you add a test for an even negative number? eg
```suggestion
example [LinearOrderedField Œ±] (a : Œ±) : 0 ‚â§ a ^ (18 : ‚Ñ§) := by positivity
example [LinearOrderedField Œ±] (a : Œ±) : 0 ‚â§ a ^ (-34 : ‚Ñ§) := by positivity
```
Ah, good catch -- that currently does not work!
I suspected so üòÑ I assume it works if instead you write `-34` as `-17 + -17`, but not very natural, of course.
It only matches on a `OfNat.ofNat` application in the exponent, so rewriting -34 like that does not work either.

Looks like your trick probably would have worked with the mathlib3 version, though: https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/blob/65a1391a0106c9204fe45bc73a039f056558cb83/src/tactic/positivity.lean#L615
I wrote this bit of the extension and I'm pretty sure it didn't work, no.
Add the test plus new logic to make it work in https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/8003/commits/27f660fe3974358e7881435aff98f9f0faa4d437
Nice!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: positivity extension for zpow
